file_content.text: I'm awaiting new orders from Darth Lachris.
My lord--we feared you wouldn't survive. It's chaos out there.
Sir! Glad to see you return from the front. It's chaos out there.
So the mercenary returns in one piece. It's chaos out there.
And who do you think is responsible for that chaos, Captain?
With every target you eliminated, the resistance became more disorganized. I've ordered all available forces to the battlefield.
Our bombers devastated the enemy in the first ten minutes. Their defenses are in shambles.
The battle can't be won yet. How will you proceed?
What comes next?
I told you I'd win you this war. So I did.
Another victory, thanks to me.
So you did, indeed.
If you think the resistance will fall this easily, you won't rule this planet for long.
They'll be back. Just watch.
Certainly we'll be cleaning up for months--but so long as they're on the defensive, they'll cease to be a threat.
We've forced their sixth battalion into Bugtown--the Colicoids are eating them alive!
I think I'd like to see that.
The lot of you are departing, I take it? Off to conquer new planets in the name of the Empire?
You'll be moving on, I presume? Letting the fires of Balmorra light your way as you terrorize the galaxy?
My master's schemes are many. And he requires me to see them through.
Darth Baras has great plans.
A fine position to be in--make sure you take advantage of it.
Something like that.
You'll be moving on, I presume? Letting the fires of Balmorra light your way as you unearth secrets for your master?
I've learned many things since becoming Sith. Not all of it needs to be shared.
For my master, and for me.
And that is why I respect you.
You'll be moving on, I presume? I'm glad someone can be trusted to stop these terrorists elsewhere.
We're facing enemies foreign and domestic. But that's why Intelligence exists.
We live in precarious times.
Then I hope it survives Darth Zhorrid's leadership; I understand she's... a woman of whims.
You'll be moving on, I presume? The job is done, time to target another world?
I follow the money. Your war's over, you don't need me.
That's the life I live.
It's almost tragic.
Something like that.
As you like.
This place isn't big enough for me.
Who'd want to be stuck here?
Be careful you don't overestimate yourself.
Colonel, prepare my shuttle.
Yes, my lord.
When you think back to Balmorra, remember the armies you laid to waste, the enemies you slew....
...and remember me, and the rewards I gave you.
Glory to the Emperor. Glory to us all.
May we all do great deeds.
I'll remember the rewards when I've spent the money.
Just transfer the credits.
You'll be pleased, I promise.
What sort of rewards were you thinking...?
[Flirt] About those rewards...
That, among others.
I helped you out. You'll help me in the future.
Just owe me a favor.
However I can, of course.
If we meet again, Darth Lachris, things will be different. Remember that.
I'll be in charge next time.
You really are an interesting creature.
Now if you'll excuse me, I have rebels to annihilate. Tell the troops, Captain, that today we win this world....
Today the resistance has fallen!
The colonel knows to expect you.
Is there something you want?
Captain Laverse, Special Tactics Group 32-Alpha--Ghost Striker Division, here by request of Darth Lachris.
My lord, we found them.
My lord, we found her.
My lord, we found him.
So I see. You weren't planning on leaving my world so soon?
Darth Lachris. Always a pleasure to speak with the lord of Balmorra.
Good to see you again.
If only pleasure were the subject at hand.
So you did. I am Darth Lachris, and I am in control of this world--I hope you weren't planning on leaving.
Darth Lachris. Hello.
Balmorra isn't the only planet where I'm needed.
I have business offworld.
Where I go and when isn't for you to decide.
That's not your concern.
But while you're here, your work is my concern.
You and I defeated the Republic at the Balmorran Arms Factory. Now the resistance grows desperate, gathering their remaining forces for a final assault.
In response to our recent attacks, the resistance grows desperate, gathering forces for a final assault.
They've got at least ten thousand veteran fighters in the valley--enough to overrun Sobrik.
Unless we stop them and obliterate the resistance army. Either way, someone's about to win the planet, and someone's about to be crushed.
If it takes a thousand days and a million men, we will conquer this world.
The Empire cannot be stopped.
What would the Dark Council say if they knew about your troubles?
Your masters can't be happy.
The Dark Council has faith in my ultimate success. Tactical assessment, Captain?
If the resistance realizes this is their only chance, you'll be in for a fight.
A cornered enemy is dangerous.
When the Imperial military can't cut it, you contact your bounty hunter.
That's why you called me.
With credits in hand.
What makes the resistance army so dangerous?
Tell me about the enemy.
I didn't come to Balmorra to eliminate the resistance. That responsibility is yours.
That's not my concern.
Yet you've entangled yourself in this war. You don't seem the type to leave loose ends.
Tactical assessment, Captain?
The enemy's using choke points and toxic hot spots in the terrain to control the flow of battle--our ground troops can't even reach their targets.
But you can give me an edge.
Join the last battle for Balmorra. Lead my army against this rebellion, and I will reward you dearly.
If we can finish the war, let's do it now. What's our plan?
Let's put an end to all this.
Your power, your title, your life--you'd lose them all if it weren't for me. Understand that.
You owe me big time.
You've served well.
I can just imagine how rewarding you can be.
[Flirt] How can I say no?
Keep your imagination focused--for now.
Colonel Proshen runs special operations on the front. He will work with you to plan a strategy.
See that this world falls to us. Lachris out.
I'll inform the colonel you're coming, my lord.
I'll inform the colonel you're coming, sir.
I'm not interested in your promises. If I face the resistance again, it'll be for my own reasons.
Don't count on my help.
So be it. End communication.
Colonel Proshen is in charge of operations on the front. He's a good man, and a good commander.
In case that means anything to you.
Not authorized to speak right now, sir.
